filmography.title: For Me and My Gal
filmography.role_description: A talented but opportunistic vaudeville performer who deliberately injures his hand to avoid the WWI draft, only to later seek redemption.
filmography.plot: Two vaudeville performers fall in love and dream of playing the Palace, but World War I interrupts their plans.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Pilot #5
filmography.role_description: An Italian-American lawyer and friend to a pilot on a suicide mission, who recounts the story of how they fought local political corruption.
filmography.plot: As a pilot embarks on a dangerous mission, his fellow soldiers recall the events from his civilian life that led him there.

filmography.title: Du Barry Was a Lady
filmography.role_description: A nightclub master of ceremonies who appears as a dashing rebel hero in a hat-check boy's dream about the court of Louis XV.
filmography.plot: A coatroom attendant wins the lottery and accidentally drinks a drugged beverage, dreaming he is King Louis XV of France.

filmography.title: Thousands Cheer
filmography.role_description: A disgruntled aerialist drafted into the army who falls for his commander's daughter and performs a famous dance with a mop.
filmography.plot: An acrobat joins the army and falls in love with the Colonel's daughter, culminating in a star-studded variety show for the troops.

filmography.title: The Cross of Lorraine
filmography.role_description: A defiant French soldier who endures torture in a Nazi prisoner-of-war camp and escapes to join the French Resistance.
filmography.plot: A group of French soldiers surrender to the Germans expecting to be sent home, but are instead imprisoned in a brutal camp.

filmography.title: Cover Girl
filmography.role_description: A nightclub owner who fears losing his girlfriend to fame when she wins a prestigious magazine cover contest.
filmography.plot: A nightclub dancer wins a contest to become a cover girl, straining her relationship with her boyfriend and manager.

filmography.title: Christmas Holiday
filmography.role_description: A charming but psychopathic Southern aristocrat and convicted murderer whose dark past haunts his wife.
filmography.plot: A soldier meets a nightclub singer in New Orleans who recounts her tragic marriage to a convicted killer.

filmography.title: Anchors Aweigh
filmography.role_description: A confident Navy sailor who tries to help his shy friend get a date while on shore leave in Hollywood.
filmography.plot: Two sailors on a four-day shore leave in Hollywood meet a young singer and try to help her get an audition.

filmography.title: Ziegfeld Follies
filmography.role: Gentleman in 'The Babbitt and the Bromide'
filmography.role_description: A song-and-dance man who performs a classic routine with Fred Astaire, poking fun at mundane social interactions.
filmography.plot: The late Florenz Ziegfeld looks down from heaven and imagines a new revue starring the greatest talent of the day.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Win – Best Musical Comedy

filmography.title: Living in a Big Way
filmography.role_description: A returning WWII veteran who finds that his hasty war marriage is crumbling and attempts to win back his wife while building housing for vets.
filmography.plot: A pilot returns home to the wife he married after a whirlwind romance, only to find she wants a divorce.

filmography.title: The Pirate
filmography.role_description: A strolling actor who masquerades as a notorious pirate to woo a lonely girl who dreams of adventure.
filmography.plot: A girl is engaged to the local mayor but dreams of a legendary pirate; a traveling actor decides to pose as the pirate to win her heart.

filmography.title: The Three Musketeers
filmography.role_description: A spirited young swordsman who travels to Paris to join the King's Musketeers and becomes embroiled in palace intrigue.
filmography.plot: D'Artagnan and his three musketeer friends fight to protect the King of France and his Queen against the scheming Cardinal Richelieu.

filmography.title: Words and Music
filmography.role_description: He appears as himself to perform the show-stopping 'Slaughter on Tenth Avenue' ballet sequence with Vera-Ellen.
filmography.plot: A biographical musical about the songwriting partnership of Richard Rodgers and Lorenz Hart.

filmography.title: Take Me Out to the Ball Game
filmography.role_description: A professional baseball player who spends his off-seasons as a vaudevillian and clashes with the team's new female owner.
filmography.plot: Two baseball players who moonlight as vaudevillians run into trouble when their team is taken over by a woman.

filmography.title: On the Town
filmography.role_description: A sailor on 24-hour shore leave in New York City who falls in love with the picture of 'Miss Turnstiles' and searches the city for her.
filmography.plot: Three sailors on a day of shore leave in New York City look for romance and adventure.

filmography.title: The Black Hand
filmography.role_description: An Italian-American who returns to New York to seek legal justice against the extortion gang that murdered his father.
filmography.plot: In early 1900s New York, a young man seeks revenge against the Black Hand gang for the murder of his father.

filmography.title: Summer Stock
filmography.role_description: A theatre director who brings his troupe to a family farm for rehearsals, clashing and then falling in love with the farm's owner.
filmography.plot: A struggling theatre company takes over a rural farm to rehearse their new show, disrupting the life of the farm's owner.

filmography.title: An American in Paris
filmography.role_description: An American ex-GI staying in Paris to become a painter, who finds himself torn between a wealthy patroness and a young French shopgirl.
filmography.plot: Three friends struggle to find work in Paris. Things become more complicated when two of them fall in love with the same woman.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Honorary Award (Gene Kelly); Oscar: Win – Best Picture

filmography.title: Singin' in the Rain
filmography.role_description: A silent film star who must make the difficult transition to talking pictures while dealing with a jealous leading lady and falling for a chorus girl.
filmography.plot: A silent film production company and cast make a difficult transition to sound.

filmography.title: The Devil Makes Three
filmography.role_description: An American soldier returning to post-war Germany who uncovers a neo-Nazi smuggling ring while trying to help a local family.
filmography.plot: An American soldier returns to Germany to visit the family who saved him during the war, only to get involved in a black market smuggling ring.

filmography.title: Seagulls Over Sorrento
filmography.role_description: A dedicated US Navy scientist sent to a remote British naval base to supervise dangerous torpedo experiments.
filmography.plot: American and British naval experts clash while testing a new type of torpedo on a remote Scottish island.

filmography.title: Brigadoon
filmography.role_description: A disillusioned New Yorker on a hunting trip in Scotland who discovers a miraculous village that appears for only one day every hundred years.
filmography.plot: Two Americans on a hunting trip in Scotland discover a magical village that appears only once every hundred years.

filmography.title: It's Always Fair Weather
filmography.role_description: A WWII veteran who becomes a disillusioned, gambling fight promoter, only to rediscover his integrity when reuniting with his war buddies.
filmography.plot: Three World War II buddies agree to meet in ten years, but when the time comes, they find they have little in common.

filmography.title: Les Girls
filmography.role_description: The leader of a dance troupe who acts as a mediator when one member sues another for libel, revealing different perspectives on their shared past.
filmography.plot: Three former showgirls recount their time with a dance troupe in Paris, each telling a conflicting version of events during a libel trial.

filmography.title: Marjorie Morningstar
filmography.role_description: A brilliant but cynical songwriter and summer stock director who engages in a tumultuous romance with a young aspiring actress.
filmography.plot: A young Jewish woman aspiring to be an actress falls in love with a charismatic but unstable songwriter against her parents' wishes.

filmography.title: Inherit the Wind
filmography.role_description: A cynical, sophisticated newspaper reporter who covers a controversial trial regarding the teaching of evolution in schools.
filmography.plot: Based on the real-life Scopes 'Monkey' Trial, two great lawyers argue the case for and against a science teacher accused of teaching evolution.
filmography.awards: Berlin International Film Festival: Win – Best Actor (Fredric March)

filmography.title: What a Way to Go!
filmography.role_description: A struggling, happy-go-lucky cabaret performer who unintentionally becomes a Hollywood star and tycoon after marrying a 'cursed' wealthy woman.
filmography.plot: A four-time widow discusses her four marriages, in which all of her husbands became incredibly rich and died prematurely.

filmography.title: 40 Carats
filmography.role_description: The charming, struggling actor ex-husband of a wealthy 40-year-old woman, who supports her new romance with a much younger man.
filmography.plot: A 40-year-old woman falls in love with a 22-year-old man while vacationing in Greece, complicating her life back in New York.

filmography.title: Xanadu
filmography.role_description: A former big-band clarinet player who teams up with a young artist and a muse to open a roller disco nightclub.
filmography.plot: A struggling artist meets a mysterious woman who inspires him to build a roller disco with the help of a former musician.
